car: <entryFree id="n6726" type="main" key="Car"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Car</orth>, <itype>Cāris</itype>, v. Caria, I. B. 1.</entryFree>
carabus: <entryFree id="n6727" type="main" key="ca_ra^bus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/rabos</foreign>, <sense id="n6727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind</hi> <cb n="CARB" /> <hi rend="ital">of sea-crab</hi>, acc. to Beckmann: Cancer cursor, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6728" type="main" key="ca_ra^bus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārăbus</orth>, <sense id="n6728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small wicker boat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered with raw hide</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 26</bibl>; cf. Vossius in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl> Oud.</sense></entryFree>
caracalla: <entryFree id="n6729" type="foreign" key="ca^ra^calla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărăcalla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cărăcallis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n6729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long tunic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">great-coat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a hood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn by the Gauls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and made of different materials</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 21</bibl>; Edict. Diocl. p. 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>, n. 15 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:93:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 93, 8</bibl>: Gallica palla).—From this garment, introduced by him, was named, </sense><sense id="n6729.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, the emperor Antoninus Caracalla, Spart. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Car. 9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Car. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 21" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Caes. 9, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caractacus: <entryFree id="n6730" type="main" key="Caracta^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caractăcus</orth>, v. Caratacus.</entryFree>
caragogos: <entryFree id="n6731" type="greek" key="ca^ra^go_go^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărăgōgŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ka/ra a)/gw</foreign>, carrying off from the head</etym>, <sense id="n6731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicinal plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caralis: <entryFree id="n6732" type="main" key="Ca^ra^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărălis</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călăris</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/ralis</foreign>, <sense id="n6732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief city of Sardinia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cagliari</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl> (Parthey, Cararis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:35" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 521</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Caralim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:35" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 500 sq.</bibl>—Access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ca-răles</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:40:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 40, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 39, 3</bibl>; and Auct. B. Afr. 98.—</sense><sense id="n6732.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărălītā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Caralis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promonturium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 84</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ALVMNO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Momms.</author> 6810</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărălītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Caralis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caralitis: <entryFree id="n6733" type="main" key="Ca^ra^li_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărălītis Pălūs</orth>, <sense id="n6733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in Lycaonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 2</bibl> (perh. Coralitis, acc. to <foreign lang="greek">*ko/ralis</foreign>, Strab. 12, p. 568).</sense></entryFree>
carambis: <entryFree id="n6734" type="main" key="Ca^rambis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărambis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cēr-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/rambis</foreign>, <sense id="n6734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory and town of the same name in Paphlagonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kerempi Bukna</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Kerembeh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:107" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 107</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Carambin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 214</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărambĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caranus: <entryFree id="n6735" type="main" key="Ca^ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n6735.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">King of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6735.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">General of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:32" default="NO">7, 4, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caratacus: <entryFree id="n6736" type="main" key="Carata^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caratăcus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Caractăcus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ca-taratacus</orth>, v. Nipp. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 33</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of the Silures in Britain</hi>, Tac. l. l. sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carbas: <entryFree id="n6737" type="main" key="Carbas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carbas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the east-northeast wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carbaseus: <entryFree id="n6738" type="main" key="carba^se^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbăsĕus</orth> (accessory form <orth extent="full" lang="la">carbă-sĭnĕus</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 541, 21</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">carbăsĭnus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 136</bibl>), a <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>carbasus</etym>, <sense id="n6738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made of carbasus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fine linen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 31, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 776</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:658" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 658</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>red</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">carbăsī-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a linen garment</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 548, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carbasum: <entryFree id="n6739" type="main" key="carba^sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbăsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. carpasum.</entryFree>
carbasus: <entryFree id="n6740" type="greek" key="carba^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <sense id="n6740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing. n.</hi> carbasum leve, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Paneg. in Theod. 33</bibl>); <number>plur.</number> heterocl. <itype>carbăsa, ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">acc. m.</hi> carbasos supremos, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 14</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ka/rpasos</foreign> [Heb. <foreign />; Sanscr. karpāsa, cotton], <hi rend="ital">very fine Spanish flax</hi> (unwrought or woven), <hi rend="ital">fine linen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cambric</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 227</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> carbasa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 17</bibl> (Bip. galbana).—</sense><sense id="n6740.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things made of carbasus, </sense><sense id="n6740.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fine linen garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 34</bibl> Serv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 541, 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 54.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:225" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 225</bibl>, and <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbasa lina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 64.— </sense><sense id="n6740.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A curtain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6740.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sail</hi>, as the Engl. <hi rend="ital">canvas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:560" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 560</bibl> Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 357</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 417</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 233</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 477</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 419</bibl>; 14, 533; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:587" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 587</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:596 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 596 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6740.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Sibylline books</hi>, <hi rend="ital">written upon linen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carbatina: <entryFree id="n6741" type="greek" key="carba^ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbătĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karbati/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n6741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rustic leather shoe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 98</bibl> (97), 4.</sense></entryFree>
carbo: <entryFree id="n6742" type="main" key="carbo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. c)ra, coquere; cf. cremo</etym>, <sense id="n6742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charcoal</hi> (dead or burning); of <hi rend="ital">dead coals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:8 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 8 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">glowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning coals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 802</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 20</bibl>, <cb n="CARC" /> 18, § 82; 16, 10, 19, § 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6742.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6742.2" n="A" level="2"> From the black color of coals are derived the trop. expressions: <cit><quote lang="la">impleantur elogiorum meae fores carbonibus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>with scurrilous verses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanin cretā an carbone notati?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> S, 2, 3, 246</bibl></cit>; imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:108" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 108</bibl> (cf. opp. albus): <cit><quote lang="la">miror Proelia rubrica picta aut carbone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6742.3" n="B" level="2"> For <hi rend="ital">something of little value;</hi> hence prov.: carbonem pro thesauro invenire, <hi rend="ital">to be deceived in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s expectation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6742.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bad tumor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 39, 725</bibl>; cf. carbunculus, C.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6743" type="main" key="Carbo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Papiria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:68 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 68 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
carbonarius: <entryFree id="n6744" type="main" key="carbo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. carbo</etym>, <sense id="n6744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to charcoal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>traffic in charcoal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 72" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6744.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6744.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">carbōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a burner of charcoal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a collier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4302</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6744.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">carbōnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n6744.4" n="1" level="3"> (Sc. fornax.) <hi rend="ital">A furnace for charcoal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Car. Christ. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6744.5" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. femina.) <hi rend="ital">The Charcoal-Woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a lost play by Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30:27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30, 27</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
carbonesco: <entryFree id="n6745" type="main" key="carbo_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbōnesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n6745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to become charcoal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:168" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:1:20" default="NO">5, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carbunculatio: <entryFree id="n6746" type="main" key="carbuncu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbuncŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carbunculo</etym>, <sense id="n6746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of trees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 222</bibl>; cf. carbunculus, C. 2.</sense></entryFree>
carbunculo: <entryFree id="n6747" type="main" key="carbuncu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbuncŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>carbunculus</etym>, <sense id="n6747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to have a</hi> carbunculus. </sense><sense id="n6747.1" n="A" level="2"> Of men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 69, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:70" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 3, 34, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6747.2" n="B" level="2"> Of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 7, 14, § 27</bibl>; and in a <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carbunculor: <entryFree id="n6748" type="main" key="carbuncu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbuncŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. carbunculo <sense id="n6748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
carbunculosus: <entryFree id="n6749" type="hapax" key="carbuncu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbuncŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>carbunculus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n6749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing red toph-stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carbunculus: <entryFree id="n6750" type="main" key="carbuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carbuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. carbo</etym>. <sense id="n6750.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small coal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6750.1" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a burning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devouring sorrow</hi>: amburet ei misero corculum carbunculus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 70</bibl> Lorenz ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n6750.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6750.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sandstone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">red toph-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 2</bibl> Schneid.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6750.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A reddish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright kind of precious stone</hi> (prob. comprising the ruby, carbuncle, hyacinth, garnet, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:92 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 92 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 28, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2510</bibl>.—Hence, ut scintillet probitas e carbunculis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">be adorned with jewels</hi>, Publ. Syr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl> Bücheler. —</sense><sense id="n6750.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A disease.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6750.6" n="1" level="3"> Of men, <hi rend="ital">a kind of tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a carbuncle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a disease in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">le charbon provençal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 4, § 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6750.7" n="2" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">a disease caused by hoar-frost</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:293" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 29, 70, § 293</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carcaso: <entryFree id="n6751" type="main" key="Carca^so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carcăso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Carcăsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 38</bibl>), <sense id="n6751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Carcassone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2 al.</bibl>; Itin. Hieros. p. 551.</sense></entryFree>
carcer: <entryFree id="n6752" type="main" key="carcer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcer</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sicilian <foreign lang="greek">ka/rkaron</foreign>; cf. O. Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 13; etym. dub.; cf. scrinium</etym>, <sense id="n6752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enclosed place;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n6752.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jail</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">custodia, vincula): si tresviri me in carcerem conpegerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1016" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1016</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=22 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:112 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36, 112 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer, quem vindicem scelerum majores nostri esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n6752.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the custody of the winds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 663</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:456" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 456</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the lower world: carcer inferorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1222" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 797</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the chains of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex corporum vinculis tamquam e carcere evolaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 721</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6752.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the Roman State-prison</hi>, close to the Forum, at the foot of the Capitoline Hill, on the right of the Sacra Via, built by Ancus Marcius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 8</bibl>; extended under ground by Servius Tullius; hence this part of the prison is called <hi rend="ital">Tullianum.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=151, p. 42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 151, p. 42</bibl> Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 25, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:51 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 51 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in inferiorem demissus carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in carcerem conditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 22, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll., and Becker. Antiq. 1, 262 sq.; v. also Tullianum and robur, II. A.—</sense><sense id="n6752.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6752.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The imprisoned criminals</hi>: in me carcerem effudistis,<pb n="291" /> <cb n="CARD" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6752.6" n="b" level="4"> As a term of reproach ( = carcerarius), <hi rend="ital">jail-bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scapegallows</hi>: carcer vix carcere dignus, Lucil. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; Ter. Phorm. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n6752.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The barrier</hi> or <hi rend="ital">starting-place in the race-course</hi> (opp. meta or calx; v. h. vv.); usu. in <number>plur.</number>, carceres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:990" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 990</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:173" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 47, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 512</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:114 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 114 al.</bibl> —In <number>sing.</number> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), Enn. Ann. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (v. 88 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 32</bibl> (imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 166</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 145</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 652</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:522" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 522</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6752.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the commencement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beginning</hi>, of a course of action or of a condition: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus carceribus decurrat ad metas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad carceres a calce revocari,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to begin life anew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aequalibus, quibus cum tamquam e carceribus emissus sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carceralis: <entryFree id="n6753" type="main" key="carce^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>carcer</etym>, <sense id="n6753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a prison</hi> (post-class.): caecitas, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 269: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 551</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 9, 3, 6.</sense></entryFree>
carcerarius: <entryFree id="n6754" type="main" key="carce^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a prison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <trans><tr>of keeping a prison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a prisonkeeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jailer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 80, 5</bibl>; Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; cf. carcer, I. C. b.</sense></entryFree>
carcereus: <entryFree id="n6755" type="main" key="carce^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a prison</hi> (post-class.; like carceralis): catena, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 6, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 468</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carcero: <entryFree id="n6756" type="main" key="carce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to imprison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incarcerate</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Prov. 2, p. 53</bibl>; Auct. Prog. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:29" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carcharus: <entryFree id="n6757" type="greek" key="carcha^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carchărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karxari/as</foreign>, <sense id="n6757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of dog-fish</hi>: Squalus carcharias, Linn.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. carcharias vulgaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carchedonius: <entryFree id="n6758" type="greek" key="Carche_do^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carchēdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karxhdo/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n6758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Carchedonian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi> (since <foreign lang="greek">*karxhdw/n</foreign> = Carthago): <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculus,</quote> <trans><tr>a brilliant precious stone frequently found in the country of the Carthaginians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:92 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 92 sq.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Car-chēdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Carthaginian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carchesium: <entryFree id="n6759" type="greek" key="carche_si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carchēsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karxh/sion</foreign>. <sense id="n6759.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek drinking - cup</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly contracted in the middle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with slender handles which reached from the rim to the bottom</hi> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:656" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 656</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:301 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 301 al.</bibl>; cf. Müll. Arch. § 299, a.—</sense><sense id="n6759.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The similarly formed upper part of a mast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mast-head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scuttle;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, Lucil. and Cat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 546, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 418</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 264, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 4, p. 364, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6759.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The upright beam of a crane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 22</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
carcine: <entryFree id="n6760" type="main" key="Carci_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carcīne</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of European Scythia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carcinethron: <entryFree id="n6761" type="greek" key="carci^ne_thron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĭnēthron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karki/nhqron</foreign>, <sense id="n6761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> polygonon, and pure Lat. geniculata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carcinias: <entryFree id="n6762" type="greek" key="carci^ni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĭnĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karkini/as</foreign>, <sense id="n6762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of the sea-crab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carcinodes: <entryFree id="n6763" type="greek" key="carci^no_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĭnōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karkinw=des</foreign>, <sense id="n6763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cancerous disease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 187</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carcinoma: <entryFree id="n6764" type="greek" key="carci^no_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĭnōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karki/nwma</foreign>, <sense id="n6764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cancerous ulcer</hi> (pure Lat. cancer), <hi rend="ital">a cancer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 13, 15, § 32 al.</bibl>—As a term of reproach applied by Augustus to Julia and her son Agrippa, on account of their incorrigible wickedness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carcinos: <entryFree id="n6765" type="greek" key="Carci^no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carcĭnŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karki/nos</foreign>, <sense id="n6765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation Cancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 536</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carcinothron: <entryFree id="n6766" type="greek" key="carci^no_thron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carcĭnōthron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karki/nwqron</foreign>, <sense id="n6766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant also called</hi> polygonon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carda: <entryFree id="n6767" type="main" key="Carda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Cardea.</entryFree>
cardaces: <entryFree id="n6768" type="main" key="Carda^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cardăces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/rdakes</foreign> [carda (Persian), strong, warlike, acc. to Strabo, 15, 3], <sense id="n6768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a class of Persian soldiers; acc.</hi> Cardacas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cardamina: <entryFree id="n6769" type="greek" key="carda^mi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardămīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kardami/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n6769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cress-like plant</hi>, i. q. nasturtium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cardamomum: <entryFree id="n6770" type="greek" key="carda^mo_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardămōmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karda/mwmon</foreign>, <sense id="n6770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cardamon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 29, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 1, 2, § 8</bibl>. <cb n="CARD" /></sense></entryFree>
cardamum: <entryFree id="n6771" type="greek" key="carda^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/rdamon</foreign>, <sense id="n6771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cress</hi> (pure Lat. nasturtium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 129" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cardea: <entryFree id="n6772" type="main" key="Carde^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cardĕa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess who presided over the hinges of doors</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">over family life</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 10</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Idol. Van. 2</bibl>; cf. Carna.</sense></entryFree>
cardia: <entryFree id="n6773" type="main" key="Cardi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cardĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kardi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the Thracian Chersonesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the gulf</hi> Melas, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Eumenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 48</bibl>.—Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cardĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cardia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eumenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cardiacus: <entryFree id="n6774" type="greek" key="cardi^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kardiako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n6774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the heart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stomach</hi>: morbus, <hi rend="ital">cardialgia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heart-burn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:30 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 30 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 71, § 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <trans><tr>suffering from a disease of the stomach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cardĭăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has heart-burn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stomach-ache</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 38, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">cured by wine, Cels. l. l.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 44</bibl></cit>; Juv. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
cardimoma: <entryFree id="n6775" type="main" key="cardi^mo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardĭmōma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">kardiwgmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n6775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pain in the stomach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:35:187" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 35, 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cardinalis: <entryFree id="n6776" type="main" key="cardi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cardo</etym>. <sense id="n6776.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a door-hinge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6776.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that on which something turns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depends</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>: venti, <hi rend="ital">the principal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cardinal winds</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 11, 14</bibl>; cf. virtutes, Hier ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>-19; Ambros. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:section=49 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, § 49 al.</bibl>—Hence, in late Lat.: cardinalia Christi opera, Cypr.—</sense><sense id="n6776.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6776.3" n="1" level="3"> As eccl. term; <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chief presbyter</hi>, as opp. to one who ministered in an <hi rend="ital">Oratorium;</hi> and esp. of such forming the council of the Pope at Rome, which afterwards consisted only of bishops, <hi rend="ital">cardinals</hi>, Anast. p. 95.—</sense><sense id="n6776.4" n="2" level="3"> In gram.: numeri, <hi rend="ital">the Cardinal Numbers</hi> (unus, duo, tres, etc., from which the <hi rend="ital">Ordinals</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Distributives</hi> are formed), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Pond. p. 1351</bibl> P.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">cardĭ-nālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi>: praesidere, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, Firm. Math. 410.</sense></entryFree>
cardinatus: <entryFree id="n6777" type="hapax" key="cardi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hinged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortised to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cardineus: <entryFree id="n6778" type="hapax" key="cardi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a door - hinge</hi>: tumultus, Sept. Afer. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2424" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2424 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
cardo: <entryFree id="n6779" type="main" key="cardo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">kra/dh</foreign>, a swing; <foreign lang="greek">kradai/nw</foreign>, to swing, wave; Sanscr. kurd, a spring, a leap; old Germ. hrad, lively, and Germ. reit in bereit, ready</etym> (<gen>f.</gen>, Gracch. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 683</bibl> P.; Graius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 202, 20</bibl>; cf. infra in Vitr.), <sense id="n6779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pivot and socket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon which a door was made to swing at the lintel and the threshold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hinge of a door</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:119" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. 119</bibl> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">paene ecfregisti foribus cardines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postis a cardine vellit Aeratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardo stridebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 449</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 222</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num muttit cardo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facili patuerunt cardine valvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versato cardine Thisbe Egreditur,</quote> <trans><tr>opening the door</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 448</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec strepitum verso Saturnia cardine fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:782 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 782 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6779.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6779.2" n="1" level="3"> Cardines, in mechanics, <hi rend="ital">beams that were fitted together;</hi> and specifically, cardo masculus, <hi rend="ital">a tenon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>, and cardo femina, <hi rend="ital">a socket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mortise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardo securiclatus,</quote> <trans><tr>axeshaped tenon</tr>, <tr>a dovetail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n6779.3" n="b" level="4"> In garlands, <hi rend="ital">the place where the two ends meet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6779.4" n="2" level="3"> In astron., <hi rend="ital">the point about which something turns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pole.</hi> So of <hi rend="ital">the North pole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: extremusque adeo duplici de cardine vertex Dicitur esse polus, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 41, 105; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:349" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 349</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardo glacialis ursae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1139" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arctoae cardo portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence anal. to this, with the agrimensores,</quote> <trans><tr>the line limiting the field</tr>, <tr>drawn through from north to south</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 326</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:169" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 22, 35, § 169</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. decimanus, p. 71 Müll., and accordingly the mountain Taurus is called cardo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">line</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 1, 3</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the four cardinal points of the world</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 67</bibl>; so, <cb n="CARE" /> Hesperius Eous, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:157" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiduus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 673</bibl></cit>.— Of <hi rend="ital">the earth as the centre of the universe</hi>, acc. to the belief of the ancients, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 64, 64, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 6, § 44</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the intersection of inclined surfaces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperiuntur (aquae) ... quodam convexitatis cardine aut montium radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 26, § 43</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the summer solstice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 264</bibl></cit>; and so of <hi rend="ital">the epochs of the different seasons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 25, 58, § 218</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:220" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 25, 59, § 220</bibl>.—Hence, of <hi rend="ital">the time of life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremus,</quote> <trans><tr>old age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 381</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6779.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that on which every thing else turns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chief point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">circumstance</hi> (so not before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">haud tanto cessabit cardine rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>at such a turn of affairs</tr>, <tr>so great a crisis</tr>, <tr>in so critical a moment</tr>, <tr>decisive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 672</bibl></cit> (hoc est in articulo, Serv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 7, 6</bibl>; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)kmh=(</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">fatorum in cardine summo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:853" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 853</bibl></cit>: litium. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satellitem in quo totius dominationis summa quasi quodam cardine continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">unum eligamus in quo est summum ac principale, in quo totius sapientiae cardo versatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carduelis: <entryFree id="n6780" type="main" key="cardu^e_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardŭēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carduus</etym>, <sense id="n6780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thistlefinch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goldfinch</hi>: Fringilla carduelis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 57, § 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46, 4</bibl>; cf. Serv. et Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 338</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 7, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carduetum: <entryFree id="n6781" type="main" key="cardu^e_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardŭētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thicket of thistles</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cardus: <entryFree id="n6782" type="main" key="cardu .s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cardu .s</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cardus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, Edict. Diocl. p. 17; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 57</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thistle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6782.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The wild thistle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 99, § 262</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 7, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6782.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The esculent thistle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artichoke</hi>, = cinara, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:152 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 43, § 152 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
care: <entryFree id="n6783" type="main" key="ca_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. carus <sense id="n6783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
carectum: <entryFree id="n6784" type="main" key="ca_rectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>carex</etym>, <sense id="n6784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place covered with sedge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sedge-plot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:22:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carenaria: <entryFree id="n6785" type="main" key="ca^re_na_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărēnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. lagena or olla) [carenum], <sense id="n6785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for making</hi> carenum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jul. 7</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
carenum: <entryFree id="n6786" type="greek" key="ca^re_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărēnum</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">caroenum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/roinon</foreign>, <sense id="n6786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sweet wine boiled down one third</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:33 al" default="NO">1, 33 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
careo: <entryFree id="n6787" type="main" key="ca^reo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căreo</orth>, <itype>ui, ĭtum</itype> (carĭtūrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 224</bibl>.—<sense id="n6787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. pr. gen. plur.</hi> carentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 255</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 472</bibl>), 2 (<hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> carint = careant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi> form careor, acc. to Caper ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">kei/rw, karh=nai</foreign>; Germ. scheeren; Engl. shear</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be cut off from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in want of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to have</hi>, whether in a good or bad sense; but <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to be devoid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be without some good;</hi> and with reference to the subjective state of mind, <hi rend="ital">to miss</hi> it (accordingly, of a good that is merely desirable, while egere is used of the want of that which is necessary); constr. regularly with <case>abl.</case>; in ante-class. poets also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <case>acc.</case> (the latter also in late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n6787.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be free from</hi> (corresp. with abesse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and opp. frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 40</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n6787.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">carere culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">febri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 15, 1</bibl></cit>, and by <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license with an inverted construction: <cit><quote lang="la">caruitne febris te heri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:41" default="NO">8, 3, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus his quasi morbis voluit carere sapientem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspiratione et periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiae atque ignorantiae crimine, Auct. B. G. 8 praef.: communi sensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <trans><tr>to be immortal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis figurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:286" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 286</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of virtue, personified: culpāque omni carens praeter se ipsam nihil censet ad se pertinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6787.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be without a thing from free-will</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to deprive one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self of a thing</hi> <pb n="292" /> <cb n="CARI" /> <hi rend="ital">not to make use of it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deny one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abstain from</hi> (syn.: abstineo, absum; hence opp. utor; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">temeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; Cic. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 5, 18</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Veneris fructu,</quote> <trans><tr>renounces not</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1073" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1073</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubidinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum facultatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieribus facile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiatis vero et expletis jucundius est carere quam frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tandem non ego illam caream, ei sit opus, vel totum triduom?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n6787.4" n="3" level="3"> Of localities, <hi rend="ital">to hold one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self aloof from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to go to;</hi> or merely, <hi rend="ital">to be absent from</hi> (cf. abstineo, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">foro, senatu, publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciā domoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectu civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamationibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensi luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6787.5" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">terra caret vero sensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 652</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:990" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 990</bibl>, and 1, 573: <cit><quote lang="la">haec duo tempora carent crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carere omni malo mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ulla putatis Dona carere dolis Danaum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec lacrimis caruere genae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars quae peste caret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio, quae astu caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oeconomia nomine Latino caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae caret ora cruore nostro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caret Ripa ventis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditu carentia saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivibus caritura Rhodope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae vero rerum vis atque vis atque majestas in omnibus momentis fide caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6787.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be deprived of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feel the want of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to want</hi> something that is desirable: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptate virtus saepe caret, nunquam indiget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam huic erat miserum carere consuetudine amicorum, societate victus, sermone omnino familiari!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac luce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciis atque oris Italiae maritimis ac portibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vate sacro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrio sepulcro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:10 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 10 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caret omni Majorum censu,</quote> <trans><tr>has lost</tr>, <tr>dissipated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6787.7" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui carendum quod erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; so Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6787.8" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia Id quod amo careo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>;
