cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 4</bibl>: eos parentes careo, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 466, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">DVLCEM. CARVI. LVCEM. CVM. TE. AMISI.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 572, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 770, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence careri,</quote> <trans><tr>pass</tr>.,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virque mihi dempto fine carendus abest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6787.9" n="B" level="2"> With the access. idea of the subjective state of mind or feeling, <hi rend="ital">to feel the want of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to miss</hi>: triste enim est nomen ipsum carendi, quia subicitur haec vis; habuit, non habet; <cit><quote lang="la">desiderat, requirit, indiget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: carere igitur hoc significat, egere eo quod habere velis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">88: non caret is qui non desiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
careor: <entryFree id="n6788" type="gloss" key="ca^re^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype>, <sense id="n6788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form of careo in old writers, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
careota: <entryFree id="n6789" type="main" key="ca^re^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărĕōta</orth>, v. caryota.</entryFree>
cares: <entryFree id="n6790" type="main" key="Ca_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cāres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. Caria, I. B. 1.</entryFree>
caresco: <entryFree id="n6791" type="gloss" key="ca^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n6791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [careo], <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ste/romai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
careum: <entryFree id="n6792" type="greek" key="ca_re^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n6792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cumin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caraway</hi>: Carum carvi, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 51, 2</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 49, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:5 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
carex: <entryFree id="n6793" type="main" key="ca_rex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reed-grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sedge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:62" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carfiathum: <entryFree id="n6794" type="main" key="carfi^a_thum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carfĭāthum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">carphĕōthum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a superior kind of incense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caria: <entryFree id="n6795" type="main" key="Ca_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kari/a</foreign>. <sense id="n6795.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A province in Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south of Lydia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the provinces Aïdin and Mentesche in Ejalet Anadoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:1" default="NO">1, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO">2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:103 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 29, § 103 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:1 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6795.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n6795.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Car</orth>, <itype>Cāris</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a Carian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 3</bibl>.—Orig., <hi rend="ital">the supposed father of the Carian race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and inventor of augury by observing the fight</hi> <cb n="CARI" /> <hi rend="ital">of birds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 203</bibl>.—And in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cāres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Carians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Gr. Cārăs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 725</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 297</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 645</bibl>; notorious for their treachery; hence the proverbial expression: quid? de totā Cariā nonne hoc vestrā voce vulgatum est, si quid cum periculo experiri velis, in Care id potissimum esse faciendum? Cic. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n6795.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cārĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Carian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 305</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cārĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (sc. ficus), <hi rend="ital">a kind of dry fig</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 26</bibl>; also for <hi rend="ital">dried figs</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 674</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 5, 10, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6795.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also Hydrela</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6795.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A harbor in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carians: <entryFree id="n6796" type="main" key="ca^ri^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caries</etym>, <sense id="n6796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decayed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carica: <entryFree id="n6797" type="main" key="Ca_ri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cārĭca</orth>, v. Caria.</entryFree>
caries: <entryFree id="n6798" type="main" key="ca^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărĭes</orth>, <itype>em, ē</itype> (other cases appear not to be in use), <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n6798.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caries</hi> (prop. of a hard, dry decay, not of rottenness); of wood, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 83, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:197" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 39, 76, § 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:212" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 78, § 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 27</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of walls,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of bones, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 21, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 2</bibl>.—Of dry soil, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11</bibl>.—Of the taste of old wine, <hi rend="ital">flatness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 22, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 4, 6, § 55</bibl>.—Of old fiuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:29:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 29, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6798.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in ridicule, of old, withered persons: nemo illā vivit carie cariosior, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 21, 27</bibl>; Turp. ib.</sense></entryFree>
carina: <entryFree id="n6799" type="main" key="ca^ri_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">ka/ruon</foreign>, cornu</etym>. <sense id="n6799.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The keel of a ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:19" default="NO">10, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 3, 5</bibl>.—In the poets very freq. (in Ovid's Met. alone about thirty times).—</sense><sense id="n6799.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6799.2" n="A" level="2"> (Pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">A vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:379" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 379</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">476</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">560</bibl> Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:250" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 9, 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 360</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 398</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6799.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of objects of similar form; of <hi rend="ital">the shells of nuts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 88</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the bodies of dogs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 110</bibl> Wernsd.; cf. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:512" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 512</bibl> and 2. carino.—</sense><sense id="n6799.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp. freq. as <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Keels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated quarter in the fourth region of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Cœlian and Esquiline Hills</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Pietro in vincoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=46 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 46 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:15 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 15 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 522 sq.: lautae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 361</bibl></cit> Serv.—Here stood also the house of Pompey, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 15</bibl>; hence the humorous play upon the word carinae, <hi rend="ital">ships</hi>' <hi rend="ital">keels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:77:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 77, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 84" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 84</bibl>; cf. Dio. Cass. 48, 38, p. 555.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6800" type="main" key="Ca^ri_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Troas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 41, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6801" type="main" key="Ca^ri_na3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 46, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carinarius: <entryFree id="n6802" type="greek" key="ca_ri_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">karo/s</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">khro/s</foreign>, cera, wax</etym>, <sense id="n6802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who colors wax-color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dyer of yellow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 36</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carinas: <entryFree id="n6803" type="main" key="Ca^ri_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33</bibl>,</sense></entryFree>
carino: <entryFree id="n6804" type="main" key="ca_ri^no1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>for scarinare, root in scortum</etym>, <sense id="n6804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi> ( = irrideo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:181" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 181</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">229</bibl> Vahl.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 361</bibl>, and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=47" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 47</bibl> Müll.: carinantes = illudentes, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6805" type="main" key="ca^ri_no2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>carina, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n6805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to supply with a shell;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, of mussels, <hi rend="ital">to get shells</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cărīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">keelformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shell-formed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concha acatii modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 49, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 82, § 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cariosus: <entryFree id="n6806" type="main" key="ca^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caries</etym>, <sense id="n6806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">decayed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotten.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6806.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">palmula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>too loose</tr>, <tr>porous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37, 1</bibl>. Cato's expression, terra cariosa, is explained by Pliny as meaning: <cit><quote lang="la">arida, fistulosa, scabra, canens. exesa, pumicosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 34</bibl></cit>; but better by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl>, as = varia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wet on the surface and dry below</hi>:—os, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <trans><tr>flat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:120" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora Falerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6806.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. caries, II.), <hi rend="ital">withered</hi>, <cb n="CARM" /> <hi rend="ital">dry by old age</hi>: nemo illā vivit carie cariosior, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 21, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 149</bibl></cit>: dii, i. e. statuae deorum, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:435" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 435</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotes perfidiā cariosi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not found.</sense></entryFree>
caris: <entryFree id="n6807" type="greek" key="ca_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kari/s</foreign>, <sense id="n6807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of seacrab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:130" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carisa: <entryFree id="n6808" type="main" key="carisa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carisa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an artful woman</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=44" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 44</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
caristia: <entryFree id="n6809" type="main" key="ca^risti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căristĭa</orth>, v. charistia.</entryFree>
caritas: <entryFree id="n6810" type="main" key="ca_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carus</etym>. <sense id="n6810.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">dearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high price</hi>, etc. (opp. vilitas): <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 92, § 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei frumentariae (opp. vilitas annonae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> caritas (sc. annonae), <hi rend="ital">high prices</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tum vendas cum caritas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alter annus in vilitate, alter in summā caritate fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:93:section=216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 93, § 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6810.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi> (cf. amor, I.; in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: benevolentia, favor, studium): cum deorum tum parentum patriaeque cultus eorumque hominum, qui aut sapientiā aut opibus excellunt, ad caritatem referri solet: conjuges autem et liberi, et fratres et alii, quos usus familiaritasque conjunxit, quamquam etiam caritate ipsā, tamen amore maxime continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 25, 88</bibl></cit>; hence, opp. amor, as <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi> to personal affection: <cit><quote lang="la">si id videare, quod sit utile ipsis, defendere... haec res amorem magis conciliat, illa virtutis defensio caritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 206</bibl></cit>; cf. Treb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui pacem belli amore turbaverant, bellum pacis caritate deponerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: amor <foreign lang="greek">pa/qos</foreign>, caritas <foreign lang="greek">h)=qos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas, quae est inter natos et parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Quint. prooem. § 6: liberalitate qui utuntur benevolentiam sibi conciliant et caritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenita erga patriam caritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinere caritatem in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine et caritate propior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritatem paraverat loco auctoritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— The subjoined <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> is usu. objective: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae et suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 24, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 51, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hieronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedium suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 42, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 14</bibl>.—But sometimes also subjective, <hi rend="ital">love entertained by one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum, deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 237</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 8</bibl> (with amor); <cit><quote lang="la">or, more rarely, of the cause or ground of the love: caritas illius necessitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number> of the different species of affection: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes omnium caritates patria una complexa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6810.2" n="B" level="2"> In late Lat., meton., caritates = cari, <hi rend="ital">the loved persons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caritores: <entryFree id="n6811" type="gloss" key="ca_ri^to_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārĭtōres</orth> <etym>1. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wool - carders</hi>, Gloss. Papiae.</sense></entryFree>
carmani: <entryFree id="n6812" type="main" key="Carma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karmanoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n6812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the Persian Gulf</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kerman</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Laristan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl> and 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 250</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">whose country was called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmānĭa</orth>, now <hi rend="ital">Kirman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carmelus: <entryFree id="n6813" type="main" key="Carme_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign />, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/rmhlos</foreign>. <sense id="n6813.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mount Carmel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep mountain in Phœnicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the sea-coast</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Karmel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Karmul;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">the town on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the god of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">this mountain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carmelum promontorium et oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 75</bibl></cit>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmel</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 29, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6813.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small town in Judœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a mountain of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Dead Sea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Josh. 15, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 15, 12</bibl>; 25, 2 al.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmēlītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Mount Carmel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Carmelite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 11, 37</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmēlī-tis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a woman of Mount Carmel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carmen: <entryFree id="n6814" type="main" key="carmen1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cas-men</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. p. 86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. p. 86</bibl> Bip.) [Sanscr. çasto<pb n="293" /> <cb n="CARM" />  declaim, praise; cf.: camilla, censeo], <sense id="n6814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">song; poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verse; an oracular response</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prophecy; a form of incantation</hi> (cf.: cano, cantus, and canto). </sense><sense id="n6814.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a tune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">song</hi>, <hi rend="ital">air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, both vocal and instrumental (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in prose, instead of it, cantus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also versus, numeri, modi): carmen tuba ista peregit ( = sonus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:508" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 508</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine vocali clarus citharāque Philammon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 317</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me (sc. Apollinem) concordant carmina nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:518" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 518</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 340: solaque culminibus ferali carmine bubo Saepe queri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 462</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 453</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cygnorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:387" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 387</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:430" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 430</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharae liquidum carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:981" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 981</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 506</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrae carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit> Hertzb.: <cit><quote lang="la">canere miserabile carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundineum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socialia carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 163</bibl></cit>.—With allusion to playing on the cithara: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc carmen hic tribunus plebis non vobis sed sibi intus canit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. Aspendius.—Also <hi rend="ital">the sound of waves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Th. 319</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 295</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6814.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a composition in verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a poem; poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">song</hi>, whether in a broader sense, of <hi rend="ital">every kind of poetic production</hi>, epic, dramatic, lyric (opp. to prose and to cantus, the melody), or, in a more restricted sense, for <hi rend="ital">lyric poetry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6814.3" n="A" level="2"> Cum hanc felicitatem non prosa modo multi sint consecuti sed etiam carmine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:27" default="NO">8, 6, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:95" default="NO">10, 1, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicuum est, et cantus (melodies) tum fuisse rescriptos vocum sonis et carmina (words),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 51, 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminibus cum res gestas coepere poetae Tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeonii carminis alite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epicum carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroici sublimitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 3, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">Iliacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia quodammodo carmen solutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pierium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:946" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 946</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina Livi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saliorum carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 3:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:61" default="NO">9, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 86</bibl> Schmid.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyricorum carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 32: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydis remixto carmine tibiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen funebre proprie Naenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina quae in Phaeacum epulis canuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lascivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:108" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscena,</quote> <trans><tr>satirical</tr>, <tr>abusive poems</tr>, <tr>libels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same: famosum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit> Schmid.: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1</bibl>. 82 Heind.: <cit><quote lang="la">obliquum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probrosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis carmen condidisset quod infamiam faceret flagitiumve alteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:10:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 10, 12</bibl></cit>; and Fragm. XII. Tab. 8, 1, ap. Wordsw. Fragm. and Spec. p. 259 sq.; Fischer ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 4</bibl>.—Phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantare cui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 75</bibl></cit>: CONDERE, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:10:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contexere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 934</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 331</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad umbilicum adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducere ad sua tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere ad lyram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6814.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6814.5" n="1" level="3"> In a restricted sense for <hi rend="ital">lyric</hi> or <hi rend="ital">epic poetry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine tu gaudes, hic delectatur iambis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit> Schmid.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina compono, hic elegos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: amabile carmen, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a love poem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">song</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 24</bibl>.—And opp. to the drama for <hi rend="ital">an epic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lyric poem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula, quae versatur in tragoediis atque carminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6814.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A part of a great epic poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primo carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:937" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 937</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6814.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A poetic inscription</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tumulum facite et tumulo superaddite carmen: Daphnis ego, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 442</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:547 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 547 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6814.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A response of an oracle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prediction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima Cumaei venit jam carminis aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 582</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 12, 4</bibl>; 29, 10, 6; 38, 45, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6814.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A magic</hi> <cb n="CARN" /> <hi rend="ital">formula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an incantation</hi>: MALVM, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 17</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Fragm. XII. Tab. 8, 1, a. ap. Wordsw. Fragm. and Spec. p. 260: polleantne aliquid verba et incantamenta carminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: carmina vel caelo possunt deducere lunam; <cit><quote lang="la">Carminibus Circe socios mutavit Ulixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:69 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 69 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:72" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 28, 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 137</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6814.10" n="6" level="3"> On account of the very ancient practice of composing forms of religion and law in Saturnian verse, also <hi rend="ital">a formula in religion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diro quodam carmine jurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 17, 9</bibl>; 1, 24, 6 and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruciatus carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex horrendi carminis erat: duumviri perduellionem judicent, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>of a dreadful form</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationis carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 64, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6814.11" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Moral sentences</hi> composed in verses: <cit><quote lang="la">Appii Caeci carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liber Catonis qui inscriptus est Carmen de moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut totum illud, VTI. LINGVA. NVNCVPASSIT., non in XII. tabulis, sed in magistri carmine scriptum videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6815" type="main" key="carmen2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a card</hi>, for wool or flax, Venant. Ep. Praem. Carm. 6, 5.</sense></entryFree>
carmenta: <entryFree id="n6816" type="main" key="Carmenta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Carmentis.</entryFree>
carmentalia: <entryFree id="n6817" type="main" key="Carmenta_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmentālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">-is</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Car-mentārĭi</orth>, v. Carmentis.</entryFree>
carmentis: <entryFree id="n6818" type="main" key="Carmentis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmentis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 277" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 277</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carmen, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n6818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman goddess of prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acc. to mythologists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mother of Evander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who went with him from Arcadia to Latium</hi> (hence Arcadia dea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:462" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 462</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasia dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:618" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tegeaea parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:627" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tegeaea sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:531" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 531</bibl></cit>, and Maenalis nympha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:634" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 634</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">and uttered oracles on the Capitoline Hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:462 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 462 sq.</bibl>; Liv. l. l.; 5, 47, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 277" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:336 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 336 sq.</bibl>, and Serv. ad h. l. —Also represented as two goddesses, Carmentes, and under the especial names Postverta and Prorsa (the backwards and forwards looking goddess), Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 16</bibl>; Serv. ad Verg. l. l.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6818.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Car-mentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Carmentis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <trans><tr>a gate at Rome</tr>, <tr>near the temple of Carmentis</tr>, <tr>in the eighth district</tr>, <tr>through which the Fabii marched to the contest so destructive to themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:15" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 47, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 338</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, as ominous, also called Porta Scelerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=334" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 334</bibl></cit>, a; 335 and 284, a Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:201" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 201</bibl>, and Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 2, p. 222.—</sense><sense id="n6818.2" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6818.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmentālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Carmentis</hi>, celebrated on the 11th and 15th of January, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 12</bibl>; Kalend. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 382</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6818.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmentārĭi</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the priests of Carmentis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 336</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carminabundus: <entryFree id="n6819" type="main" key="carmi^na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭnābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. carmino</etym>, <sense id="n6819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">versifying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carminatio: <entryFree id="n6820" type="main" key="carmi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. carmino</etym>, <sense id="n6820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguium,</quote> <trans><tr>with the claws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carminator: <entryFree id="n6821" type="gloss" key="carmi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carder</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carmino: <entryFree id="n6822" type="main" key="carmi^no1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. carmen</etym>, <sense id="n6822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make verses</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">votivum quippiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba Graia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6823" type="main" key="carmi^no2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. carmen</etym>, <sense id="n6823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to card</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carmo: <entryFree id="n6824" type="main" key="Carmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Hispania Baetica, now <hi rend="ital">Carmona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 21, 8</bibl> (acc. to Cod. Bamb.); Auct. B. Alex. 57.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmonenses</orth>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carna: <entryFree id="n6825" type="main" key="Carna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Cardea</etym>, <sense id="n6825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, previously called Crane, <hi rend="ital">guardian of doorhinges</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">of domestic life</hi>) <hi rend="ital">and the life of man</hi>, Ov F. 6, 101 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnalis: <entryFree id="n6826" type="main" key="carna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnal</hi> (opp. to spiritalis; <cit><quote lang="la">eccl. Lat.): delicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1051</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālĭa</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">carnal things</hi> (opp. spiritalia), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 17, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carnally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 54</bibl>, n. 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 436</bibl>. <cb n="CARN" /></sense></entryFree>
carnalitas: <entryFree id="n6827" type="main" key="carna_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carnalis</etym>, <sense id="n6827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshli ness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnality</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 186" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Temp. 2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Temp. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnaliter: <entryFree id="n6828" type="main" key="carna_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. carnalis <sense id="n6828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
carnarius: <entryFree id="n6829" type="main" key="carna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to flesh; subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6829.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">carnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n6829.2" n="A" level="2"> Carnarius <foreign lang="greek">krewpw/lhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a butcher</hi>, Gloss. Vet.—</sense><sense id="n6829.3" n="B" level="2"> Humorously, <hi rend="ital">one who admires a plump habit of body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lump of flesh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:100:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 100, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6829.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">car-nārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n6829.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A frame furnished with hooks to hang up meats over the hearth for smoking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drying</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 400, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">545, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 53, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:135:4" default="NO">135, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:136:1" default="NO">136, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6829.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A larder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pantry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 60, § 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:57" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 4, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnatio: <entryFree id="n6830" type="hapax" key="carna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpulency</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:113" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnatus: <entryFree id="n6831" type="hapax" key="carna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpulent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carneades: <entryFree id="n6832" type="main" key="Carne^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnĕădes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karnea/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n6832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished philosopher of Cyrene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of the Stoic Diogenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founder of the New Academy in Athens</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 45, 137</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 38, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:1" default="NO">17, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6832.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnĕădēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-dīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Carneades</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:71 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 71 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
carneus: <entryFree id="n6833" type="main" key="carne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of flesh</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n6833.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 344" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 344</bibl></cit>: membra, Maximian. Gall. 1, 85.—</sense><sense id="n6833.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">carnal</hi> (opp. spiritalis): <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 370</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carni: <entryFree id="n6834" type="main" key="Carni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Celtic people in Upper Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east of Aquileia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending to Cärnthen</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Krain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4040</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">their chief town was</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 1, 2</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <trans><tr>the Carnic Alps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carnicula: <entryFree id="n6835" type="gloss" key="carni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flesh</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 684</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
carnifex: <entryFree id="n6836" type="main" key="carni^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭfex</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">carnŭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>v. caro-facio</etym>, <sense id="n6836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an executioner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hangman</hi>, Plaut Bacch. 4, 4, 37; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1017</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 97, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:175 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 175 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">this office was considered so disgraceful that he was not permitted to live in the city</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4 sq.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">but in the Subura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n6836.1" n="b" level="4"> As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">scoundrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rascal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 220</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6836.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tormenter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 27</bibl> Don.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 56, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:23" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 42, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna gloriae carnifex,</quote> <trans><tr>murderer</tr>, <tr>destroyer of fame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 39</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">murderous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnifex avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:84:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 84, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes (sc. podagrici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 48, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:173" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <trans><tr>deadly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carnificina: <entryFree id="n6837" type="main" key="carni^fi^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭfĭcīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">carnŭf-</orth>), ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carnifex</etym>. <sense id="n6837.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The office of executioner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hangman; capital punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnificinam facere = carnificem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus carnificinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6837.1" n="II" level="1"> Per meton., <hi rend="ital">the rack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>: dolores atque carnificinas facere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 187, 30</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">carnificinam subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ergastulum et carnificinam duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6837.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis perturbatio miseria est, tum carnificina est aegritudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 135</bibl> (= crudelitas).</sense></entryFree>
carnifico: <entryFree id="n6838" type="main" key="carni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭfĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">carnŭf-</orth>), <itype>ātus, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.) [id.], <sense id="n6838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnifical. (hostes) jacentes,</quote> <trans><tr>to be cut in pieces</tr>, <tr>mangled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: vitam cum dolore et insigni cruciatu carnificatus amisit, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carniger: <entryFree id="n6839" type="main" key="carni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro-gero</etym>, <sense id="n6839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing flesh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Eccl. Hist. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
