so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1002" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1002</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1430" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1430</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longos ciebat Incassum fletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot incassum fusos patiere labores?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 421</bibl></cit>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">quae profecto incassum agebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 11</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">vana incassum jactare tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incassum missae preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid incassum disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:15:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 11, 1</bibl>: frustra in cassumque. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 10</bibl>.— Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cassum</orth>: quid cassum times? Sen. <cb n="CAST" /> Herc. Oet. 353; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">ma/thn</foreign>, frustra, nequicquam, cassum, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
castabala: <entryFree id="n6970" type="main" key="Casta^ba^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Castăbăla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 5</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Castăbălenses</orth>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castalia: <entryFree id="n6971" type="main" key="Casta^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Castălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kastali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain on Parnassus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to Apollo and the Muses</hi>, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=310" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 310</bibl>, b Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:698" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 698</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6971.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n6971.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castă-lĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Castalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 229" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 229</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:565" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <trans><tr>the laurel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 3, 13; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cave of the oracle at Delphi</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6971.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Castalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 14</bibl></cit>; also as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Castalidum grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:12:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castana: <entryFree id="n6972" type="main" key="Castana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Castana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Magnesia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castanea: <entryFree id="n6973" type="greek" key="casta^ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castănĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/stanon</foreign>. <sense id="n6973.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The chestnut-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:14" default="NO">5, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 78, § 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:147" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 20, 34, § 147</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 71</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6973.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A chestnut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 18, 32, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:112" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 28, 34, § 112</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">appos. castaneae nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 26, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castanetum: <entryFree id="n6974" type="main" key="casta^ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castănētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>castanea</etym>. <sense id="n6974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chestnut-grove</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:3" default="NO">4, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caste: <entryFree id="n6975" type="main" key="caste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. castus <sense id="n6975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
castellanus: <entryFree id="n6976" type="main" key="castella_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castellānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>castellum</etym>, <sense id="n6976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a fort</hi> or <hi rend="ital">castle</hi>: triumphi, <hi rend="ital">for the capture of a castle</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:256" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 73, 256</bibl>: miles, Cod. Th. 7, 15, 2.—</sense><sense id="n6976.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">castellāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the occupants of a castle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 42:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 42, 3</bibl>; Liv 34, 27, 2; 38, 45, 9.</sense></entryFree>
castellarius: <entryFree id="n6977" type="main" key="castella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the superintendent of a reservoir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 117" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2899 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
castellatim: <entryFree id="n6978" type="main" key="castella_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castellātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">castle-wise</hi>: dissipati, <hi rend="ital">scattered about</hi>, qs. <hi rend="ital">in different fortresses</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in separate detachments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 10</bibl>: grumulis imponere allium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in clusters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hills</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castellum: <entryFree id="n6979" type="main" key="castellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>castrum</etym>, <sense id="n6979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a castle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">citadel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stronghold</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 514, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 440</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 34 al.</bibl>; also of a single <hi rend="ital">bulwark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bastion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of <hi rend="ital">a dwelling in an elevated position</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 475</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6979.1" n="B" level="2"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">a structure in which the water of an aqueduct is collected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be distributed by pipes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">channels in different directions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reservoir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 35" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:1" default="NO">43, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3203 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6979.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stronghold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuge</hi> (cf. arx, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">templum Castoris fuit arx civium perditorum... castellum forensis latrocinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem philosophiae, mihi crede, proditis, dum castella defendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunal Appii castellum omnium scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
casteria: <entryFree id="n6980" type="hapax" key="caste_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castērĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of a ship where rowers were accustomed to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the rowers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">room</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 10</bibl> (16); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castifico: <entryFree id="n6981" type="main" key="casti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>castificus</etym>, <sense id="n6981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to purify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make pure</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:9 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
castificus: <entryFree id="n6982" type="main" key="casti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>castus-facio</etym>. * <sense id="n6982.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Purifying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavacrum = baptisma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 25, 188</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n6982.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 169" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castigabilis: <entryFree id="n6983" type="hapax" key="casti_ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castīgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>castigo</etym>, <sense id="n6983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deserving punishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castigate: <entryFree id="n6984" type="main" key="casti_ga_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castīgātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. castigo <sense id="n6984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
castigatio: <entryFree id="n6985" type="main" key="casti_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>castigo</etym>, <sense id="n6985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a correcting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correction</hi>, etc. (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n6985.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6985.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen., of blows. etc. (rare, and always with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fustium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6985.3" n="2" level="3"> Of verbal chastisement, <hi rend="ital">reproof</hi>, etc. (class. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis et animad. versio et castigatio contumeliā vacare debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 137</bibl>: admonitio frequens, interdum et castigatio,<pb n="298" /> <cb n="CAST" />  vindicta rarissima, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:54" default="NO">3, 8, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:15:1" default="NO">1, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:27:3" default="NO">2, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:72:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 72, 14</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46, 11 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6985.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gardening, <hi rend="ital">a trimming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lopping of plants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 173</bibl>.—Of the exposure of their roots to the cold, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 262</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6985.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <trans><tr>the tempering</tr>, <tr>moderating of the speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castigator: <entryFree id="n6986" type="main" key="casti_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castīgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>castigo</etym>, <sense id="n6986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who corrects</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chastises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a corrector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprover</hi> (not in Cic.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimarum atque inertium querelarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 4</bibl></cit>: castigator censorque minorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot saeculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:40:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 40, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castigatorius: <entryFree id="n6987" type="main" key="casti_ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castīgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>castigator</etym>, <sense id="n6987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after the manner of reprovers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">correctors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censuring</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">solatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castigo: <entryFree id="n6988" type="main" key="casti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>castum-ago, as purgo = purum-ago</etym>, <sense id="n6988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set right by word</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to correct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punish; to blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find fault with</hi> (syn.: animadvertere, punire; more forcible than reprehendere and vituperare; weaker than culpare; <cit><quote lang="la">class. in prose and poetry): pueros non verbis solum, sed etiam verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 64</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 3, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā clade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo saepius (magister) monuerit, hoc rarius castigabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudat Pompeius... segniores castigat atque incitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castigando increpandoque plus quam leniter agendo, proficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos exuviis bubulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dictis plurumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 387</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 15, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 31, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 109, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc me ipse castigo quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnitiem hominum atque inertiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:41:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 41, 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimiam lenitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:117:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 117, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:12:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 12, 6 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6988.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6988.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To correct some error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mend</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose) ( = corrigere, emendare): carmen, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 294</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicae verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:455" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">examen improbum in trutină,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:46:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 46, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6988.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to restrain;</hi> lit. and trop. (rare for the more usu. coërcere, cohibere, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid illum credis facturum, nisi eum ... servas, castigas, mones?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum tenacem, non parentem frenis asperioribus castigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castigatus animi dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum crebris potiunculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:700" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 700</bibl></cit>; cf. under <pos>P. a.</pos>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6988.4" n="b" level="4"> Of relations of space, <hi rend="ital">to enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula castigatur aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:355" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 355</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">castīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose), <hi rend="ital">confined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compressed;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n6988.5" n="1" level="3"> As a designation of physical beauty, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:43" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6988.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">restrained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">checked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria tanto castigatior, quanto posset esse liberior, Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 24: castigatissima disciplina,</quote> <trans><tr>the strictest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 1</bibl></cit> Hertz (Cod. Reg. castissima).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">castīgātē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n6988.7" n="a" level="4"> (Acc. to castigatus, 1.) <hi rend="ital">Compressedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castigatius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castigatius eloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6988.8" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to 2.) <hi rend="ital">Restrainedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within bounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixit modeste, castigate, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 6:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castimonia: <entryFree id="n6989" type="main" key="casti_mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castīmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">castĭmōnĭ-nium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11</bibl>. p. 266, 9; cf. castimonium <foreign lang="greek">a(gnei/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.) [castus, like acrimonia, aegrimonia, etc.]. *<sense id="n6989.0" n="I" level="1"> Ingen., <hi rend="ital">purity of morals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6989.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such as is requisite for religious services</hi> (abstaining from sexual intercourse, from delicate food, etc.), <hi rend="ital">purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstinence</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae sacra per summam castimoniam virorum ac mulierum fiant, eadem per istius stuprum ac flagitium esse violata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CAST" /> 4, 45, § 102 Zumpt: caste jubet lex adire ad deos; animo videlicet, in quo sunt omnia; <cit><quote lang="la">nec tollit castimoniam corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio castimoniarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 8, 44</bibl></cit>. § <cit><quote lang="la">96: inanima,</quote> <trans><tr>abstinence from animal food</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 272, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castimonialis: <entryFree id="n6990" type="hapax" key="casti^mo_ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castĭmōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>castimonia</etym>, <sense id="n6990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to abstinence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 12, p. 92</bibl></cit> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
castimonium: <entryFree id="n6991" type="gloss" key="casti^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castĭmōnĭum</orth>, v. castimonia.</entryFree>
castitas: <entryFree id="n6992" type="main" key="casti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>castus</etym>, <sense id="n6992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6992.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">purity of morals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morality</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6992.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6992.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Purity of body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastity</hi> (rare but class.; syn. pudicitia): ut sentiant mulieres naturam feminarum omnem castitatem pati, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl> Mos.; so * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl>. —Hence, person.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castĭtas</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of Chastity</hi>, = Minerva, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6992.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Purity</hi> with regard to gain, <hi rend="ital">disinterestedness</hi> (opp. avaritia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3, § 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castitudo: <entryFree id="n6993" type="hapax" key="casti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (ante-class. access. form to castitas; cf.: bellitudo, canitudo, etc.), <sense id="n6993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moral purity</hi>: antiqua, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castor: <entryFree id="n6994" type="greek" key="castor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/stwr</foreign>, <sense id="n6994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the castor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaver;</hi> pure Lat. fiber: Castor fiber, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 3, 13, § 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 30, 47, § 109</bibl>; Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nux. 166</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> castorem, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6995" type="main" key="Castor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Castor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype> (acc. to some gramm. Castōris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 60</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/stwr</foreign>. <sense id="n6995.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of the Spartan king Tyndarus and Leda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Helena and Pollux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as twin star</hi> (Gemini; <cit><quote lang="la">hence even Castores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 4, 10, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 22, 22, § 86</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">alter Castor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:16" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 16</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">he served as a guide to mariners</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudet equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 25</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 401</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Castoris (sc. aedem),</quote> <trans><tr>on the forum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 91</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">where pecuniary affairs were transacted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:260" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 260</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6995.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6995.2" n="A" level="2"> In oaths: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ecastor</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mecastor</orth> <etym>the old <pos>interj.</pos> e or the <hi rend="ital">pron. acc.</hi> me, prefixed; cf.: equidem, edepol; mehercle, medius fiduis, etc., v. Corss. Ausspr. II. p. 856 sq.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">by Castor</hi>, an oath in very frequent use, especially by women, though not exclusively by them, as asserted by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 6, 1</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 183</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecastor, re experior, quanti facias uxorem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecastor vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ecastor scitus (i. e. perscitus ecastor) puer est natus Pamphilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nunc mecastor quid hero ego dicam queo comminisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul, 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 63</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 11</bibl>; 4, 4, 9; 5, 1, 26: <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Salve, mecastor, Parmenio. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Et tu, edepol, Syra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 8</bibl> Don. —</sense><sense id="n6995.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ad Castŏris</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŏcus Ca-stŏrum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place in Upper Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Cremona and Bedriacum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where stood a shrine of Castor and Pollux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6995.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. of Castor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 810" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 810</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6995.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6995.6" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The grandson of king Deiotarus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 1, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 28</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n6995.7" n="V" level="1"> Castor Tarcondarius, <hi rend="ital">a chieftain of Gallogrœcia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ally of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6995.8" n="VI" level="1"> Antonius Castor, <hi rend="ital">an author on botany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 17, 66, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 2, 5, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castoreum: <entryFree id="n6996" type="main" key="casto^re^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castŏrĕum</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. castor</etym>, <sense id="n6996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">castor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">castoreum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a secretion of the beaver having a strong odor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 47, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 794</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:3" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 3</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> C. 224</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castoreus: <entryFree id="n6997" type="main" key="Casto^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Castŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Castor, II. C.</entryFree>
castorinatus: <entryFree id="n6998" type="main" key="casto^ri_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castŏrīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. castor</etym>, <sense id="n6998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in the fur of the beaver</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castorinus: <entryFree id="n6999" type="main" key="casto^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castŏrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining<cb n="CAST" />  to the beaver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaver-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 35</bibl></cit>: pellis, Edict. Diocl. p. 23.</sense></entryFree>
castra: <entryFree id="n7000" type="main" key="castra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castra</orth>, <itype>ōrum and ae</itype>, v. castrum.</entryFree>
castrametor: <entryFree id="n7001" type="main" key="castra^me_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castră-mētor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n7001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pitch a camp</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> 4, 54 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
castranus: <entryFree id="n7002" type="main" key="Castra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Castrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n7002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of Castrum Inui</hi> (v. castrum, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:60" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castratio: <entryFree id="n7003" type="main" key="castra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>castro</etym>. <sense id="n7003.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An emasculating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castration of animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:11:1" default="NO">7, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 38</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7003.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pruning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castrator: <entryFree id="n7004" type="main" key="castra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who castrates</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castratorius: <entryFree id="n7005" type="hapax" key="castra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for castration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castratura: <entryFree id="n7006" type="main" key="castra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. *<sense id="n7006.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An emasculalion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castration of animals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7006.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pruning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleansing of plants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siliginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castrensiani: <entryFree id="n7007" type="main" key="castrensi^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castrensĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>castra</etym>, <sense id="n7007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">attendants of the Castrensis S. Palatii</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 32; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 36, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castrensiarius: <entryFree id="n7008" type="gloss" key="castrensi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castrensĭārĭus</orth> <itype>NEGOTIATOR</itype>, <sense id="n7008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purveyor for the camp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suttler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castrensis: <entryFree id="n7009" type="main" key="castrensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>castra</etym>, <sense id="n7009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">per-taining to the camp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">camp-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio ac militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 9, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: corona, <hi rend="ital">awarded to him who first entered the enemy</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s camp</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6, 17</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57</bibl> Müll. (also called vallaris, v. h. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">jocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 46</bibl></cit>: exsilium. sarcastically, for <hi rend="ital">military service</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4, 14</bibl>: verbum, <hi rend="ital">a military phrase</hi> (e. g. conterraneus, copiari, q. v.), Plin. praef. § 1 Sill.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">peculium,</quote> <trans><tr>obtained in military service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:17:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 17, 11</bibl></cit> v. peculium: creditores, <hi rend="ital">who have a claim against the soldier</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s pay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:17:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 17, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7009.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">castrensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n7009.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A soldier in the camp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietem omnibus castrensibus dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:30" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7009.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A high officer of the imperial court of Constantinople</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 32, 1; 12, 1, 38.</sense></entryFree>
castricius: <entryFree id="n7010" type="main" key="Castricius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Castricius</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n7010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman gentile name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 185</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 23, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 28, 3 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castriciānus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tiānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a Castricius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 23, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castro: <entryFree id="n7011" type="main" key="castro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. çastra, knife, sword</etym>. <sense id="n7011.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deprive of generative power</hi> (both of male and female), <hi rend="ital">to emasculate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">geld</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit> and 4: <cit><quote lang="la">agnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 208</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 21, 25, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:261 al" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 51, 112, § 261 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7011.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to plants, <hi rend="ital">to prune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 33, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 8, 33, § 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7011.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: vina saccis, <hi rend="ital">to pass through a sack</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to filter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 53</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:138 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 138 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siligo castrata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cleaned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7011.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to shorten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudas catulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 41, 63, § 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvos apum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take up</tr>, <tr>to take out the honey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:11" default="NO">9, 15, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castrare alvearia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7011.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to enervate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debilitate</hi>: castrata res publica morte Africani, <hi rend="ital">weakened</hi> (a vulgar figure, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi illum (Maecenatem) enervasset felicitas, immo castrasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos,</quote> <trans><tr>to remove obscenity</tr>, <tr>to expurgate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:35:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 35, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <trans><tr>to diminish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to check</tr>, <tr>restrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 1, 192</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
castrum: <entryFree id="n7012" type="main" key="castrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindred with casa, q. v.</etym>. <sense id="n7012.0" n="I" level="1"> In <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">any fortified place; a castle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortress</hi> (more rare than castellum): <cit><quote lang="la">ei Grunium dederat in Phrygiā castrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32</bibl>. 29, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7012.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7012.2" n="1" level="3"> Castrum Altum or Album, in Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 41, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.3" n="2" level="3"> Castrum Inui, or simply Castrum, <hi rend="ital">an ancient city of the Rutuli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Ardea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 775</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Castrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 727</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:359" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 359</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7012.4" n="3" level="3"> Castrum Novum, <hi rend="ital">a city on the seacoast of Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.5" n="4" level="3"> Another Castrum Novum, <hi rend="ital">on the sea-coast of Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Giulia Nova</hi>, <pb n="299" /> <cb n="CAST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 110</bibl>; also called <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Castrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:8" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.6" n="5" level="3"> Castrum Truentinum, <hi rend="ital">a maritime city of Picenum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Truentus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, B, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Truentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.7" n="6" level="3"> Castrum Vergium, <hi rend="ital">a fortress of the Bergistani in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">Berga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 21, 1</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n7012.8" n="II" level="1"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">castra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">castra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: castra haec vestra est, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 200, 30</bibl>; Trag. Rel. p. 238 Rib.). </sense><sense id="n7012.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">several soldiers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">tents situated together;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a military camp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an encampment;</hi> among the Romans a square (quadrata); <cit><quote lang="la">later, after the manner of the Greeks, sometimes circular, or adjusted to its situation,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 23</bibl></cit>. It was surrounded by a trench (fossa) and a wall (vallum), and had four gates: Porta Praetoria, the front, chief gate, on the opp. side from the enemy, from which the legions marched; opp. to this, Porta Decumana (in later times Porta Quaestoria), the back gate; <cit><quote lang="la">Porta Principalis Dextra, and Porta Principalis Sinistra, situated on the two sides of the camp,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 27, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. Dict. of Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n7012.10" n="b" level="4"> Phrases. </sense><sense id="n7012.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">stativa,</quote> <trans><tr>occupied for a long time</tr>, <tr>permanent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestiva,</quote> <trans><tr>summer camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35, 13</bibl></cit> (more freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> aestiva and hiberna, q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">navalia,</quote> <trans><tr>an encampment on the shore for protecting the fleet and the troops while landing; sometimes connected with the ships drawn to land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl></cit> Herz.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also nautica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 11, 6</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39</bibl>): lunata, <hi rend="ital">crescent-shaped</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 80.—With <hi rend="ital">numerals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">una,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 27, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum castris antecapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capere locum castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 17, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and montes castris capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 55</bibl></cit>: castra metari, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 137, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:15 al" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 15 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 29 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere et munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 28, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra castris conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 32, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 28, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris se tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra movere,</quote> <trans><tr>to break up</tr>, <tr>to decamp</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; also syn. with <hi rend="ital">to march forth from a camp</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15</bibl> Herz.; 1, 22; 2, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.—Hence, also, promovere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">removere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris castra inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:201" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. 201</bibl></cit> Vahl.—</sense><sense id="n7012.13" n="c" level="4"> Castra Praetoriana, Praetoria, Urbana or simply Castra, <hi rend="ital">the barracks of the Prœtorians in the suburbs of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7012.14" n="d" level="4"> Castrorum filius, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Caligula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was brought up in the camp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 3</bibl>.—So, Castrorum mater, <hi rend="ital">an appellation of Faustina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of the emperor Marcus Aurelius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because she accompanied him in an expedition against the Quadi</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Marc. Aur. 26</bibl>.—Hence both appell. in later inscriptions as <hi rend="ital">titles of the Roman emperors and empresses.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n7012.15" n="B" level="2"> Esp. as <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>, like castrum. </sense><sense id="n7012.16" n="1" level="3"> Castra Corneliana or Cornelia, <hi rend="ital">on the north coast of Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Utica</hi>, so called because the elder Scipio Africanus first pitched his camp there, after his landing in Africa, in the second Punic war, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.17" n="2" level="3"> Castra Caecilia, <hi rend="ital">in Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 117</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.18" n="3" level="3"> Castra Hannibalis, <hi rend="ital">a seaport town in Bruttium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.19" n="4" level="3"> Castra Pyrrhi, <hi rend="ital">a place in Grecian Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.20" n="5" level="3"> Castra Vetera or Vetera, <hi rend="ital">a place on the Lower Rhine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Xanthen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.21" n="6" level="3"> Castra Alexandri, <hi rend="ital">a district in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7012.22" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7012.23" n="1" level="3"> Since, in military expeditions, a camp was pitched each evening, in the histt. (esp. Livy) for <hi rend="ital">a day</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s march</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundis castris ( = bidui itinere) pervenit ad Dium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alteris castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So tertiis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 24, 1</bibl>; <cb n="CAST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 46, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quintis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decimis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 33, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.24" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Military service</hi> (hence, often opp. forum and toga), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 125, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui magnum in castris usum habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.25" n="3" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">beehives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in apium castris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.26" n="4" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">a sheepfold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:23:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 23, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.27" n="5" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">political parties</hi>, regarded as arrayed in hostility: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad interdicti sententiam confugis... in meis castris praesidiisque versaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 29, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7012.28" n="6" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">philosophical sects</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicuri castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O castra praeclara (Epicuri)!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castula: <entryFree id="n7013" type="gloss" key="castu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment used by women</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of petticoat</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 548, 30 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
