castulo: <entryFree id="n7014" type="main" key="Castu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Castŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Liv.), and <gen>f.</gen> (Sil.), = <foreign lang="greek">*kastou/lwn</foreign>, <sense id="n7014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">near the borders of</hi> Baetica, now the village <hi rend="ital">Cazlona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 41, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 19, 2</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:99" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:391" default="NO">3, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 2, 3, § 17</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7014.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castŭlōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Castulo</hi>: saltus, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20, 12</bibl>; and as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castŭlōnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Castulo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
castum: <entryFree id="n7015" type="main" key="castum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. castus <sense id="n7015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
castus: <entryFree id="n7016" type="main" key="castus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>i. e. cas-tus, partic., kindr. to Sanscr. çludh, to cleanse; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kaq-aro/s</foreign>; Germ. keusch, heiter; cf. the opp. in-ces-tus, impure, Bopp, Gloss. 351, 6; Pott. 1, 252</etym>. <sense id="n7016.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">morally pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolluted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spotless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guiltless</hi>, = purus, integer (gen. in respect to the person himself, while candidus signifies pure, just, in respect to other men; v. Doed. Syn. p. 196 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">class. in prose and poetry): castus animus purusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vita purissima et castissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quis hoc adulescente castior? quis modestior? quis autem illo qui maledicit impurior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurum castus (fraudasse dicatur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castissimum quoque hominem ad peccandum potuisse impellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli fas casto sceleratum insistere limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Et frugi castusque verecundusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (animi) se integros castosque servavissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Crassi castissima domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <trans><tr>signs</tr>, <tr>indications of innocence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <trans><tr>inviolable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:285" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saguntum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decet nos esse a culpā castos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res familiaris casta a cruore civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7016.1" n="II" level="1"> In respect to particular virtues. </sense><sense id="n7016.2" n="A" level="2"> Most freq., esp. in poetry, in regard to sexual morality, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolluted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:424" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. 424</bibl></cit> Vahl.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:23" default="NO" valid="yes">62, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:83" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 544</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 711</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia = Iphigenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bellerophon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:139" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 139</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castus ab rebus venereis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">lectulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 66, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos virginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 62, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gremium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 65, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 799</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 385</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7016.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style, <hi rend="ital">free from barbarisms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caius Caesar sermonis praeter alios suae aetatis castissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n7016.4" n="B" level="2"> In a religious respect, <hi rend="ital">pious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred</hi>, = pius: <cit><quote lang="la">hac casti maneant in religione nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 409</bibl></cit> Wagn.— <cit><quote lang="la">So, Aeneas (for which elsewhere pius in Verg.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:42" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sanctus princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:1:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego qui castam contionem, sanctum campum defendo (in respect to the preceding: in Campo Martio, comitiis centuriatis auspicato in loco),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of things: sacrae, religiosae castaeque res, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 267, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud satis castum donum deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">festa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 71</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">ara castis Vincta verbenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castior amnis (sc. Musarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castum flumen (on account of the nymphs),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Stil. 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pura castaque mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: casta mola <cb n="CASU" /> genus sacrificii, quod Vestales virgines faciebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65</bibl> Müll.—As epith. ornans of poetry, since it is used in defence of the Deity: casta poesis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 267, 14</bibl> (it is erroneously explained by Non. by suavis, jucundus).—</sense><sense id="n7016.5" n="2" level="3"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">castum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">period of time consecrated to a god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during which strict continence was enjoined</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=124:25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 124, 25</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Isidis et Cybeles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7016.6" n="C" level="2"> In respect to the property and rights of others, <hi rend="ital">free from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstinent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disinterested</hi>: manus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 267, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo castus ac non cupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castissimus homo atque integerrimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 68</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">castē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n7016.7" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Purely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spotlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uprightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere aetatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et integre vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7016.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Chastely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuously</hi>: caste se habere a servis, C. Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri eloquentiam ut adultam virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:330" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 330</bibl></cit>.—Of language, <hi rend="ital">properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">classically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caste pureque linguā Latinā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7016.9" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Piously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placare deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7017" type="main" key="castus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">castus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<case>abl.</case> heterocl. casto, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 16</bibl>; Fest. s. v. minuitur, p. 154, 6 Müll.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. castus</etym>, ante- and post-class. for castimonia, <sense id="n7017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abstinence from sensual enjoyments on religious grounds</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 197, 16</bibl>; Varr. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
casualis: <entryFree id="n7018" type="main" key="ca_su^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>casus</etym>. <sense id="n7018.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Casual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortuitous</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">condicio,</quote> <trans><tr>depending upon chance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 51, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsŭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">accidentally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7018.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">relating to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declined with cases</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Casuale, ut ab equo: equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=52, p. 116" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 52, p. 116</bibl></cit> Bip.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">18, p. 164 Bip.: formae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 672</bibl></cit> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
casualiter: <entryFree id="n7019" type="main" key="ca_su^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsŭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. casualis, I. <sense id="n7019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
casula: <entryFree id="n7020" type="main" key="ca^su^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căsŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>casa</etym>, <sense id="n7020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cottage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">77, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 153</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7020.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sepulchre</hi> = hypogeum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
casus: <entryFree id="n7021" type="main" key="ca_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsus</orth> (Ciceronis temporibus paulumque infra s geminabatur: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cassus</orth>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl>; cf.: causa, Juppiter al.; in inscr. also KASVS), ūs (<case>dat.</case> casu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 4</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cado</etym>. <sense id="n7021.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a falling</hi> (acc. to cado, I. A. and C.). </sense><sense id="n7021.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A falling down</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">stillicidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 50, 51, § 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 259</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsae graviore casu Decidunt turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 231</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7021.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a throwing down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occumbunt multi letum praecipe casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:391" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 391</bibl></cit> Vahl.: eoque ictu me ad casum dari, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus, quo (infantes) in terram toties deferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1333</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 21 al.</bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: cum loci Inciperent casus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (by an earthquake), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 714</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7021.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7021.4" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremae sub casum hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 340</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7021.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A moral fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a false step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas vias adulescentiae lubricas ostendit (natura), quibus illa insistere, aut ingredi sine casu aliquo ac prolapsione vix posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 41</bibl></cit>.—So of a political fall, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 67, 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7021.6" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">change</hi> from a higher to a lower condition: <cit><quote lang="la">secum reputans quam gravis casus in servitium ex regno foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7021.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which turns out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">happens unexpectedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an occurrence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">event</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emergency</hi> (this most freq. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim aliud fors, quid fortuna, quid casus, quid eventus, nisi cum sic aliquid cecidit, sic evenit, ut vel non cadere atque evenire, vel aliter cadere atque evenire potuerit? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: quis iste tantus casus? unde tam felix concursus atomorum? cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi casus temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:20:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod consilium etsi in ejusmodi casu reprehendendum non est, tamen incommode accidit,</quote> <trans><tr>such an emergency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in ejusmodi casu accidit, periti ignaris parebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:8" default="NO">10, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 8, 5</bibl>: potest igitur veritatem <pb n="300" /> <cb n="CATA" /> casus imitari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 21, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tantam Rutulis laudem, casusne deusne, Attulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive illud deorum munus sive casus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae casus obtulerat, in sapientiam vertenda ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quemque casus armaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quos locus aut casus conjunxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 97 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aleam tanti casus se regnumque dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrium casūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casum potius quam consilium sequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: parata ad omnes casus eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis jam eventuum, satis casuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversi, secundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirificus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rariores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">varii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiti repentinique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in <case>abl.</case>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">casu</orth>, <itype>adverbially</itype>, <hi rend="ital">by chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by accident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accidentally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si haec habent aliquam talem necessitatem, quid est tandem, quod casu fieri aut forte fortunā putemus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id evenit non temere nec casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive casu sive consilio deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitate an casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu an persuasu et inductu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu an manibus impeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit casu ut legati, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 359</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 84</bibl> et saep.—Hence, also, </sense><sense id="n7021.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi> for something (esp. freq. in Sall. and Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">aetas illa multo pluris quam nostra casus mortis habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis durae casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut vi aut dolis sese casum victoriae inventurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclari facinoris casum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 56, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">si casus daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invadendae Armeniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene gerendae rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casum adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.— Since the idea of suddenness, unexpectedness, easily passes into that of hostility, adverseness (cf. accido, 4.), casus signifies, </sense><sense id="n7021.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an adverse event</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mishap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">sumfora/</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum illum casum tam horribilem, tam gravem, tam repentinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 24, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolens civitatis casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 14, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 28, 11</bibl>.—Of disease: <cit><quote lang="la">si alius casus lecto te adfixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 473</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 494</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res minime in hujusmodi casu noxia,</quote> <trans><tr>in the earthquake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis Trojanae,</quote> <trans><tr>overthrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 623</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7021.10" n="b" level="4"> Euphemist. for <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnini atque Gracchorum casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui quemque casus per quinquennium absumpsissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7021.11" n="D" level="2"> In gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a case</hi> in the inflection of words: <cit><quote lang="la">propter eorum qui dicunt, sunt declinati casus, uti is qui de altero diceret, distinguere posset, quom vocaret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 16</bibl></cit> Müll.: casus dicimus... et vocabulorum formas, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 11</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (verba) sic et casibus et temporibus et genere et numero conservemus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbari casus... casus rectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominativo, dativo, ablativo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: Latinus, sextus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the ablative</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 277</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">conversi, i. e. obliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 64</bibl></cit>: interrogandi (i. e. genetivus), Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 26</bibl> Hertz: <cit><quote lang="la">vocandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7022" type="main" key="Ca_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cāsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Albania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that flows into the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cata: <entryFree id="n7023" type="greek" key="ca^ta^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătă</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/</foreign>, in distrib. sense, <sense id="n7023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciet sacrificium super eo cata mane mane,</quote> <trans><tr>morning by morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 46, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 14.</sense></entryFree>
catabasis: <entryFree id="n7024" type="greek" key="ca^ta^ba^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăbăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <case>abl.</case> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/basis</foreign>, <sense id="n7024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a ceremonial at the festival of the Magna Mater</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catabathmos: <entryFree id="n7025" type="main" key="Ca^ta^bathmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăbathmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*katabaqmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tract of land in Libya</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Egypt and Cyrenaica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Akabah</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a city of the</hi> <cb n="CATA" /> <hi rend="ital">same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:1" default="NO">1, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catabolcnses: <entryFree id="n7026" type="main" key="ca^ta^bo^lcnses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăbŏlcnses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a class of carriers who transport burdens by means of draught animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of muleteers</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 3, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. Ep. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catacecaumene: <entryFree id="n7027" type="main" key="Ca^ta^ce^caume^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăcĕcaumĕnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*katakekaume/nh</foreign> (scorched), <sense id="n7027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region of Mysia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Mœonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorched by the sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but abounding in vines.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăcĕcaumĕ-nītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*katakekaumeni/ths</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">oi/=nos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the wine of this region</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 75</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catachana: <entryFree id="n7028" type="greek" key="ca^ta^cha_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăchāna</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-channa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kataxh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n7028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree inoculated with buds of different fruit-trees</hi>, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:1, p. 77" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 1, p. 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7028.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of parodies, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catachresis: <entryFree id="n7029" type="greek" key="ca^ta^chre_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăchrēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/xrhsis</foreign>, a rhet. figure, <sense id="n7029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an improper use of a word;</hi> in pure Lat. abusio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:5" default="NO">8, 2, 5</bibl>; and Don. p. 1775 P. (where, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 94</bibl>, it is written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
cataclista: <entryFree id="n7030" type="greek" key="ca^tacli_sta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătaclīsta vestis</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">kata/kleiston i/ma/tion</foreign> [to be kept shut up; cf.: <sense id="n7030.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">vestis seposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>], <hi rend="ital">a splendid garment for festal occasions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a state dress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 21, p. 261</bibl> Bip.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătaclīstĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of a state dress</hi>: fila, Ven. vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cataclysmos: <entryFree id="n7031" type="greek" key="ca^ta^clysmo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăclysmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kataklusmo/s</foreign>. <sense id="n7031.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A deluge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ogygi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 153" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 153</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 40</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7031.1" n="II" level="1"> In medicine, <hi rend="ital">a pouring of water upon a diseased member</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shower-bath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">douche</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:1:4" default="NO">1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:3" default="NO">2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catacumba: <entryFree id="n7032" type="gloss" key="ca^ta^cumba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăcumba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">catacombs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4575</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catadromus: <entryFree id="n7033" type="greek" key="ca^ta^dro^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătădrŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/dsomos</foreign>, <sense id="n7033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rope for rope-dancers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 2, 2, § 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catadupa: <entryFree id="n7034" type="main" key="Ca^ta^du_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătădūpa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kata/doupa</foreign>, <sense id="n7034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the celebrated cataract of the Nile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Syene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Egypt</hi> (cf. cataracta), now <hi rend="ital">Chellal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 4, § 14</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătădūpi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those dwelling near</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 29, 35, § 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataegis: <entryFree id="n7035" type="greek" key="ca^taegis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătaegis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kataigi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent storm of wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hurricane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whirlwind</hi>: procellosus flatus cataegis dicitur, App. de Mundo, p. 62, 28; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in Pamphylia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:17:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catagelasimus: <entryFree id="n7036" type="greek" key="Ca^ta^ge^la^si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăgĕlăsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">katagela/simos</foreign>, <sense id="n7036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for ridicule; subst. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a banterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeerer</hi>, in a pun with Gelasimus, the name of a parasite: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo ex Gelasimo fleri te Catagelasimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catagraphus: <entryFree id="n7037" type="greek" key="ca^ta^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăgrăphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/grafos</foreign>. <sense id="n7037.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Painted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depicted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thyni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7037.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăgră-pha</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">profile paintings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">side views</hi> (pure Lat. obliquae imagines), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catagusa: <entryFree id="n7038" type="greek" key="Ca^ta^gu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăgūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/gousa</foreign> (bringing back), <sense id="n7038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a statue of Praxiteles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">representing Ceres as bringing back Proserpine to Pluto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 69</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:Catal. Artif. p. 380" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> Catal. Artif. p. 380</bibl>, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
catalauni: <entryFree id="n7039" type="main" key="Ca^ta^launi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătălauni</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĕlauni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe in</hi> Gallia Belgica, near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Chālons-sur-Marne</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătălaunĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at Catalauni</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catalecta: <entryFree id="n7040" type="greek" key="Ca^ta^lecta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătălecta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kata/lekta</foreign>, <sense id="n7040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a collection of poems ascribed to Virgil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Tech. 12</bibl>; v. Wagn. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> IV. p. 341 sq.</bibl>; Forbig. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> III. p. 719</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
catalecticus: <entryFree id="n7041" type="greek" key="ca^ta^le_cti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătălēctĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">katalhktiko/s</foreign>: <sense id="n7041.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>a verse in which a syllable is wanting at the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1216</bibl></cit> P.— Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătălēctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhktos</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 501</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
catalepsis: <entryFree id="n7042" type="greek" key="ca^ta^le_psis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătălēpsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhyis</foreign>, <sense id="n7042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sudden attack of sickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catalepsy</hi> (pure Lat. apprehensio or oppressio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10:56" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catalepticus: <entryFree id="n7043" type="greek" key="ca^ta^le_pti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătălēptĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">katalhptiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cataleptic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10:74 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10, 74 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
catalogus: <entryFree id="n7044" type="greek" key="ca^ta^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătălŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/logos</foreign>, <sense id="n7044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enumeration</hi> (post-class.): virtutum, Hier. <cb n="CATA" /> Ep. 83.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a list of names</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a catalogue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Iliad. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catamitus: <entryFree id="n7045" type="main" key="Ca^ta^mi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătămītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-meitus</orth>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>corrupt collat. form of Ganymedes; v. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:44:6" default="NO">44, 6</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n7045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Latin name of Ganymede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s cup-bearer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 3</bibl>; Prud. c. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:70" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7045.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as appel. = pathicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. Her. 33, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 31</bibl>; v. Ganymedes.</sense></entryFree>
catampo: <entryFree id="n7046" type="gloss" key="catampo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">catampo</orth>, <sense id="n7046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of play</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=44" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 44</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
catana: <entryFree id="n7047" type="main" key="Ca^ta^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Catina.</entryFree>
catanance: <entryFree id="n7048" type="greek" key="ca^ta^nance_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătănancē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katana/gkh</foreign>, <sense id="n7048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant used in magical love potions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 35, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataonia: <entryFree id="n7049" type="main" key="Ca^ta^o^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kataoni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a province in Southern Cappadocia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4, 1</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataphagas: <entryFree id="n7050" type="greek" key="ca^ta^pha^gas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăphăgas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katafaga/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataphasis: <entryFree id="n7051" type="greek" key="ca^ta^pha^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăphăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> cataphasin), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an affirmation</hi> (pure Lat. affirmatio, aientia; opp. apophasis or abnuentia), Aur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Rhet. 11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Rhet. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 27, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataphractarius: <entryFree id="n7052" type="main" key="ca^ta^phracta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăphractārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cataphractes</etym>, <sense id="n7052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mailed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clad in mail</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 56</bibl>; Decius ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 16</bibl>; cf. cataphractus.</sense></entryFree>
cataphractes: <entryFree id="n7053" type="greek" key="ca^ta^phractes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăphractes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katafrakth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coat of mail furnished with iron scales</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> cataphracten, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataphractus: <entryFree id="n7054" type="greek" key="ca^ta^phractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăphractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/fraktos</foreign>, <sense id="n7054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mailed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in mail</hi> (of soldiers and their horses), Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 556, 16 sq.</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 57</bibl> Dietsch).—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătă-phracti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">mailed soldiers</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">loricatos, quos cataphractos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 40, 5 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 12, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 770</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Princ. Hist. 5, p. 247" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Princ. Hist. 5, p. 247</bibl> Nieb.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 804</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catapirates: <entryFree id="n7055" type="main" key="ca^ta^pi_ra_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăpīrātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katapeira=th/r</foreign>, <sense id="n7055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sounding-lead</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 4, 10</bibl> (p. 82, 11 Gerl.).</sense></entryFree>
cataplasma: <entryFree id="n7056" type="greek" key="ca^ta^plasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăplasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 14</bibl> (<case>abl.</case> cataplasmatibus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 25</bibl>; access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăplasmus</orth>; only <sense id="n7056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> cataplasmo, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 311, 25</bibl>, and <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> cataplasmis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 3</bibl> b; 5, 2, 2; cf. Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gr. p. 267</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kata/plasma</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">in medicine,</quote> <trans><tr>a poultice</tr>, <tr>plaster</tr>, <tr>cataplasm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>, and l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:133" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 17, 28, § 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataplasmo: <entryFree id="n7057" type="main" key="ca^ta^plasmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăplasmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cataplasma</etym>, <sense id="n7057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to apply a poultice to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19:120" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19, 120</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; Macer. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:18, v. 723" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 18, v. 723</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataplus: <entryFree id="n7058" type="main" key="ca^ta^plus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăplus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/plous</foreign> (<sense id="n7058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the coming to shore of a fleet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ship;</hi> hence, abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">the ship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fleet that comes to land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Puteolanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl></cit> B. and K. dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:74:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 74, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Urb. 13, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catapotium: <entryFree id="n7059" type="greek" key="ca^ta^po^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăpŏtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katapo/tion</foreign> (that which is swallowed down); <sense id="n7059.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in medicine,</quote> <trans><tr>a pill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 89" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 89</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataprorates: <entryFree id="n7060" type="spur" key="ca^ta^pro_ra_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăprōrātes</orth>, a false read. for catapirates.</entryFree>
catapulta: <entryFree id="n7061" type="greek" key="ca^ta^pulta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăpulta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o/ katape/lths</foreign>, <sense id="n7061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large engine of war for throwing arrows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stones</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a catapult</hi> (cf. ballista): <cit><quote lang="la">catapultis ballistisque per omnia tabulata dispositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximae formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 47, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 11, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 15</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 22</bibl>; Naev., Lucil., Varr., and Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 552, 17 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9 al.</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n7061.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, like ballista, for <hi rend="ital">the missile itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 17</bibl>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 552, 11 sq.</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 125 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
catapultarius: <entryFree id="n7062" type="main" key="ca^ta^pulta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăpultārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>catapulta</etym>, <sense id="n7062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to the catapult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is thrown by it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cataracta: <entryFree id="n7063" type="greek" key="ca^ta^racta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăracta</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătarracta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cătarractes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Plin. and Sol.; <sense id="n7063.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), = <foreign lang="greek">o( katarra/kths</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">katara/kths</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n7063.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a waterfall</hi>, in gen.; <hi rend="ital">the waterfalls of the Euphrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 85</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7063.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> and <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/u</foreign>, <pb n="301" /> <cb n="CATE" /> <hi rend="ital">the celebrated fall of the Nile on the southern borders of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Cataract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimo catarracte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> catarracten, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenit ad cataractam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cataractae, nobilis insigni spectaculo locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipites cataractae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 317</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7063.3" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a drawbridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portcullis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 28, 10</bibl> and 11.—</sense><sense id="n7063.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A water-sluice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">floodgate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 61</bibl> (69), 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> 1, 481</bibl> Zumpt.—</sense><sense id="n7063.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A waterbird</hi> (that pounces down quickly), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 44, 61, § 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataractes: <entryFree id="n7064" type="main" key="Ca^ta^ractes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăractes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătarrhactes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*katarrakths</foreign>, <sense id="n7064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Pampnylia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Duden Su</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 26, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cataractria: <entryFree id="n7065" type="hapax" key="ca^ta^ractri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătăractrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a word coined to designate a kind of spice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catarrhactes: <entryFree id="n7066" type="main" key="ca^tarrhactes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătarrhactes</orth>, v. cataracta <sense id="n7066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, and Cataractes <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
catarrhus: <entryFree id="n7067" type="greek" key="ca^tarrhus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătarrhus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/rrous</foreign>, <sense id="n7067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the catarrh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rheum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catasceua: <entryFree id="n7068" type="greek" key="ca^tasceua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătasceua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kataskeuh/</foreign>; rhet. t. t., <sense id="n7068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the confirmation of an assumption</hi> (opp. anasceua), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 12, 1 sq.</bibl>; cf. Sulp. Vict. Inst. Or. § 3.</sense></entryFree>
catascopus: <entryFree id="n7069" type="greek" key="ca^tasco^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătascŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/skopos</foreign> (exploring, spying (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cătascŏpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">katasko/pion</foreign>, <sense id="n7069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lookoutship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spy-ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel sent out to reconnoitre</hi> (pure Lat. navigium speculatorium), Auct. B. Afr. 26; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catasta: <entryFree id="n7070" type="greek" key="ca^tasta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătasta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kata/stasis</foreign></etym> (postAug.), <sense id="n7070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scaffold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stage</hi>, </sense><sense id="n7070.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">On which slaves were exposed for sale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:77" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 77</bibl> Schol.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 18, 58, § 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7070.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">For the public burning</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of criminals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">martyrs</hi>, etc.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 56; 2, 399 al.—</sense><sense id="n7070.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">For delivering a lecture</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> 1, 393</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catastalticus: <entryFree id="n7071" type="greek" key="ca^tastalti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătastaltĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">katastaltiko/s</foreign>; in medicine, <sense id="n7071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restraining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">checking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> catastalticum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 28, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catastatice: <entryFree id="n7072" type="greek" key="ca^tastati^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătastatĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katastatikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n7072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called in pure Lat. scelerata, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catastema: <entryFree id="n7073" type="greek" key="ca^taste_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătastēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/sthma</foreign>, <sense id="n7073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi> of a star: <cit><quote lang="la">recursu catastematis (sc. solis et siderum),</quote> <trans><tr>at the close of a cycle</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catastropha: <entryFree id="n7074" type="greek" key="ca^tastro^pha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătastrŏpha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katastrofh/</foreign> (rare; cf. <sense id="n7074.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">casus),</quote> <trans><tr>the turning - point of an action</tr>, <tr>catastrophe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 54, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catatechnos: <entryFree id="n7075" type="main" key="Ca^ta^techno^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătătechnŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Catatexitechnos.</entryFree>
catatexitechnos: <entryFree id="n7076" type="greek" key="Ca^ta^texi^techno^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătătexĭtechnŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*katathcitexnos</foreign> (he who enervates art by excessive polishing), <sense id="n7076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of the artist Callimachus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 92</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătătechnŏs</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">*kata/texnos</foreign>; cf. Sillig, Catal. Artif. pp. 123-128).</sense></entryFree>
catatonus: <entryFree id="n7077" type="greek" key="ca^ta^to^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătătŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kata/tonos</foreign>, <sense id="n7077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stretching down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depressed</hi> (opp. anatonus): <cit><quote lang="la">capitulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
